abstract.t: In Allied Communications Publication (ACP) 133 [1], an X.500 directory user schema, called Common Content, is specified for the Allied Directory. In order to enable Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) access to the Allied Directory and to enable the general use by others of elements from the Common Content, this document specifies the encoding of the Common Content using the LDAP notation from Request for Comments (RFC) 2252 [2].
